** Carnage didn�t smile as Teltoli made her little comments about 
cybertronian food, but rather was more interested in her answer to her 
question. She really did want to know because she had never had any move 
from family after her father had died and she had forgotten how it feels 
like.
Though, Carnage hadn�t failed to see just how Teltoli had drawn back at her 
question, almost as if it was something strange and probably the last thing 
the fuzor ever expected her to ask. But she had and she wanted to know.
But the look in her green eyes dulled slightly as Teltoli began to explain 
it, and it was rather hard for her to hear it when she spoke of how they 
were always there to support.
It was hard for her and she knew it, and she couldn�t possibly really know 
what Teltoli was trying to express through her words because she hadn�t 
experienced anything like it that she could still remember.
A long time ago: she thought. I knew the answer to this question. But now I 
have to ask.
Carnage sighed and then turned her reptilian head so that she was looking 
straight again, even though she no longer carried her head as high as she 
had before. Touchy subjects were always hard to explain and deal with but it 
was all part of every day life. If you couldn�t deal with it then you 
couldn�t deal with life.
She glanced towards Teltoli.** � I would give anything to have a fight with 
my parents.� Just to hear their voices again: she finished inside of her 
mind.
Teltoli was so lucky! She had grown up on a nice family and was basically 
protected all her life, or that was what she was getting from that she told 
her. She had both her parents.
Carnage looked at her, another question forming on her mind.** � What was 
your life like when you were growing up?� ** another honest question. But 
Carnage wasn�t asking these just to compare them to her own life, she was 
actually formulating something in her mind which just might help Teltoli 
become the warrior she wished to be�if she ever asked her to teach her 
anything.**
